description: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of dispersed Dyck paths of length n (i.e., of Motzkin paths of length n with no (1,0)-steps at positive heights) for which the sum of the heights of its base pyramid is k. A base pyramid is a factor of the form U^j D^j (j>0), starting at the horizontal axis. Here U=(1,1) and D=(1,-1).
